items.name: Ext.util.Cookies
items.text: Utility class for setting/reading values from browser cookies. Values can be written using the set method. Values can be read using the get method. A cookie can be invalidated on the client machine using the clear method.

items.name: set
items.text:
Creates a cookie with the specified name and value. Additional settings for the cookie may be optionally specified
(for example: expiration, access restriction, SSL).

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the cookie to set.

items.name: value
items.text: The value to set for the cookie.

items.name: expires
items.text:
Specify an expiration date the cookie is to persist until. Note that the specified Date
object will be converted to Greenwich Mean Time (GMT).

items.name: path
items.text:
Setting a path on the cookie restricts access to pages that match that path. Defaults to all
pages ('/').

items.name: domain
items.text:
Setting a domain restricts access to pages on a given domain (typically used to allow
cookie access across subdomains). For example, "sencha.com" will create a cookie that can be accessed from any
subdomain of sencha.com, including www.sencha.com, support.sencha.com, etc.

items.name: secure
items.text:
Specify true to indicate that the cookie should only be accessible via SSL on a page
using the HTTPS protocol. Defaults to false. Note that this will only work if the page calling this code uses the
HTTPS protocol, otherwise the cookie will be created with default options.

items.name: get
name
items.text: The name of the cookie to get

Returns the cookie value for the specified name;
null if the cookie name does not exist.

items.name: clear
items.text:
Removes a cookie with the provided name from the browser
if found by setting its expiration date to sometime in the past.

items.name: name
items.text: The name of the cookie to remove

items.name: path
items.text:
The path for the cookie.
This must be included if you included a path while setting the cookie.
